page.title: 12Housing - Gypsy Caravan Site
page.content: Ten families of Romanies have bought a field adjoining the M6 motorway and are hoping for planning permission to use it as a permanent site. The family group have installed electricity and toilet facilities for use by the whole site. They have covered the site with hard core, but have also fenced off a grassy area as a playing field for the children. They are meeting stern opposition and find in twentieth century society a bit of predjudice and antagonism. They want a permanent site so that the children can have an education. The families have also faced increasing difficulties in finding sites when travelling, which is another reason for trying to establish a permanent site.
